content.text: You're at the self-checkout in a Dutch supermarket. The machine is beeping, and an employee has come to help. They ask you a question you don't understand.

data.phrase: Ik spreek niet zo goed Nederlands
data.meaning: I don't speak Dutch very well

data.tip: The Dutch 'g' is a soft, throaty sound, similar to the 'ch' in the Scottish 'loch'.

content.text: Great! The employee now understands the situation and will try to simplify their question.
To negate a thing, use 'geen'. For example, to say you don't have 'a bonuskaart', you say 'geen bonuskaart'.
